definition: unprepared/off guard
(negative prefix)/not/no
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom)/to take sb by surprise
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

sentences.english: Our boss caught us off guard and showed up at the office suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老板趁我们不备时突然出现在办公室。

sentences.english: SNAKE, having made his hole close to the porch of a cottage, inflicted a mortal bite on the Cottager's infant son.
sentences.chinese: 一条毒蛇趁人不备爬进农夫家，咬死了农夫的儿子。

sentences.english: Then while the unprepared shut the door.
sentences.chinese: 随后趁其不备关上了房门。

sentences.english: Conclusion unprepared, incredibly encountered under four dragon king at the hands of latent.
sentences.chinese: 岂料不备之下，居然遭遇了四龙王手下的潜伏。

sentences.english: At this time has been dispersed, however they will then leapt out unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 此时已经散去，然而它们定然会再蹿出来攻其不备。

definition: to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom)/to take sb by surprise
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
usual trick/old tactics
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to neglect to take precautions/relaxed vigilance
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to repeat an old stratagem/up to one's old tricks
to take the opportunity/to take a plane
thoughtless/not pay attention to
seeing riches provokes evil designs
to steal away/to beat it
top secret/hush-hush
pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: to leave in stealth/to slip away
to look for an opportunity
